III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are 6 youth on suicide and self-harm watch and only one
staff member on third shift to supervise. There are concerns
regarding sufficiency and safety. The staff member's walkie talkie
does not work most of the time and management are located at an
unreasonable distance.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
04/05/2024.
Interviews:
I contacted the Complainant on 04/05/2024 no additional was
information provided.
I notified Foster Care Worker on 04/05/2024 of the investigation
via email.
I spoke with Chief Administrator (CA) on 04/09/2024 via
telephone. CA reported Youth A was removed from the facility on
04/05/2024 and is currently placed at Midland JJC due to his
aggressive behavior and frequent AWOLing.
I interviewed Youth A at the Midland Juvenile Justice Center on
04/10/2024. Youth A is 13 years old and has been at current
placement for 5 days. Youth A reported he was previously placed
at Queen of Angels for 2 months. Youth A said there were always
staff supervising and staff did complete checks when he was in his
room every 5 to 10 minutes. Youth A admitted he AWOLed when
he was at Queen of Angels and staff followed him and tried to talk
him into not AWOLing. Youth A did not express any concerns
regarding staff not supervising.
2

I interviewed Chief Administrator (CA) at the facility on
04/10/2024. CA reported they do not currently have any youths on
suicide watch. Youth A was put on a 1:1 during the day by the
facility due to his behavior. She denied the facility being short
staffed or only having one staff member for third shift. She said
there are three units next to each other and the supervisor office is
between the three units. For third shift there is one staff on each
unit and each unit currently has six youths. There is always a
supervisor on third shift that can assist and covers for staff during
breaks and lunches. She is not aware of any complaints about the
walkie talkies not working or being short staffed during third shift.
The agency’s ratio for sleeping hours is 1:8.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 04/10/2024. She denied
having any youths on suicidal watch and being short staffed
during third shift. She said there is always one or two staff on each
unit and a supervisor to assist during breaks and lunches. She
further denied any reports of the walkie talkies not working. She
said Youth A was put on a 1:1 due to his aggressive behavior.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 04/10/2024. Youth B has
been at the facility for 10 months. Youth B reported there is
always two staff members on his unit and when he is in his room,
staff check on him every five minutes. Youth B said there are six
boys on his unit including him. Youth B is participating in therapy,
gets enough to eat, takes his medication daily, and feels safe.
Youth B expressed no concerns regarding staff supervision.
I toured the facility on 04/10/2024. I observed the three units and
the supervisor office that is located between the three units.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 05/14/2024 via telephone. Staff 2 has
been working at the agency for six years and works third shift.
Staff 2 is not aware of any youths being on suicidal watch. They
reported there is usually one or two staff members on each unit.
They denied any concerns for not having enough staff during third
shift or the walkie talkies not working. They said there is always a
supervisor on site and will assist if needed. Staff 2 said they feel
very supported by supervisor and administrators.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 05/14/2024 via telephone. Staff 3 is a
youth specialist and has been working at the facility for 2 years.
Staff 3 denied having any youths on her unit on suicidal watch.
Staff 3 said there is six youths on the unit. Staff 3 reported they
are always in ratio, and they are not aware of issues regarding
3

staff sufficiency and safety. Staff 3 said there is always a
supervisor on site and will respond and assist if needed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staffing Policy: Staff ratios are 1:3 during waking hours and
1:8 sleeping hours.
• Youth A’s activity plan: Walk outside, engage in building
toys, and watch television.
• Staff Schedule for the week of 04/13/2024. Third Shift has
three Direct Care Staff and one Supervisor scheduled.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is no evidence the
facility does not have sufficient staff during third shift. The facility
is compliant with the rule as there is no evidence that there was
not sufficient staff,
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
